Package com.github.tadukoo.util.lookandfeel.paintui

Class ColorPaintUIResource

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Color
javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource
com.github.tadukoo.util.lookandfeel.paintui.ColorPaintUIResource
All Implemented Interfaces:
PaintUIResource, SizablePaint, java.awt.Paint, java.awt.Transparency, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.plaf.UIResource
public class ColorPaintUIResource
extends javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource
implements PaintUIResource
ColorPaintUIResource is a PaintUIResource to be used in TadukooLookAndFeel for custom paints if you want a solid color. Using this class allows supporting other component UI classes that may not allow a solid color. It extends ColorUIResource.
Version:
Alpha v.0.2
Author:
Logan Ferree (Tadukoo)
See Also:
Serialized Form

    • getColorUIResource

      public javax.swing.plaf.ColorUIResource getColorUIResource()
      Description copied from interface: PaintUIResource
      In some cases, we need to return a ColorUIResource to support the Look & Feel properly. I don't like it, but it needs to be done for those Look & Feel pieces to work, and I'm trying to support all of them.
      Specified by:
      getColorUIResource in interface PaintUIResource
      Returns:
      this

    • getMetalGradientList

      public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getMetalGradientList()
      Description copied from interface: PaintUIResource
      Metal Look and Feel has a trash way of handling gradients. Basically it takes 3 colors and 2 fractions, but with the 3 colors, it repeats color 1 and does 1, 2, 1, 3. The fractions represent the 2 middle points, but the 2nd point is calculated as mid1 * 2 + mid2.

      This method exists for the purpose of appeasing the Metal Look & Feel god who decided this disgusting way of code.
      Specified by:
      getMetalGradientList in interface PaintUIResource
      Returns:
      A List<Object> for use in Metal gradients that will produce a solid color
